From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Aragonese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Navarro-Aragonese començar, from Vulgar Latin *cominitiāre, from com- + Latin initiāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /komenˈθa(ɾ)/
  • IPA(key): /komenˈsa(ɾ)/ (Benasquese)
  • Syllabification: co‧men‧zar
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

comenzar

  1. to begin, to commence
    Synonyms: principiar, emprincipiar, prencipiar, emprencipiar, iniciar
    Me voi sentar en el chardín, y voi comenzar a leyer un libro prou interesant.
    I sat (on a chair, bench) in the garden, and I started to read a very interesting book.
    Ya podez comenzar.
    You may commence.

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • escomenzar

Related terms

[edit]
  • comienzo

Further reading

[edit]
  • Diccionario ortografico de l'aragonés (Seguntes la PO de l'EFA)

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Vulgar Latin *cominitiāre.

Verb

[edit]

comenzar (first-person singular indicative present comienzo, past participle comenzáu)

  1. to begin, start
    Synonyms: entamar, apenzar, empecipiar, emprimar, aniciar, empezar

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • comienzu

Galician

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

comenzar (first-person singular present comenzo, first-person singular preterite comencei, past participle comenzado)

  1. alternative form of comezar

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Spanish començar, from Vulgar Latin *cominitiāre, from com- + Latin initiāre. Did not show diphthongized conjugations in early medieval texts; their later appearance seems to reflect analogy with the synonym empezar.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /komenˈθaɾ/ [ko.mẽn̟ˈθaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /komenˈsaɾ/ [ko.mẽnˈsaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: co‧men‧zar

Verb

[edit]

comenzar (first-person singular present comienzo, first-person singular preterite comencé, past participle comenzado)

  1. to begin, to commence
    Synonym: empezar
    Yo me senté sobre un banco en el jardín, y comencé a leer un libro interesante.
    I sat on a bench in the garden, and I started to read an interesting book.
    Usted puede comenzar.
    You may commence.

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Related terms

[edit]
  • comienzo
  • iniciar

Descendants

[edit]
  • Papiamentu: kuminsá
